title.native: 阿波連さんははかれない

description:
The story follows the "indecipherable" daily life of the short and quiet Reina Aharen and Raidou who sits next to her. Aharen is not so good at gauging the distance between people, and Raidou initially felt some distance between the two of them. One day, when Raidou picked up the eraser that Aharen had dropped, the distance between them suddenly became uncomfortably close.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

node.description:
__Doujin Circle:__ Milmake Orange (ミルメークオレンジ)
__Loves:__ Sushi and Uniforms

[Website](http://mizuasato.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mizuasato) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/13134)

[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/kosaki) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_kosaki)

A Japanese composer and arranger. He joined NAMCO as a soundtrack composer in 1999, and then he joined MONACA Inc. as a music designer in 2004.

Soundtracks he has worked on credited as MONACA: 
- Star Driver: Kagayaki no Takuto (with Keigo Hoashi and Ryuichi Takada) 
- Hourou Musuko (with Keigo Hoashi and Keiichi Okabe) 
- A-Channel (with Kakeru Ishihama, Ryuichi Takada, Keigo Hoashi)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yasukiti01)

__Hometown:__ Anjo, Aichi Prefecture, Japan

Yasutaka Yamamoto debuted as a storyboard maker and a producer with episode 34 of Idaten Jump (2005) after working as an assistant producer for My Melody (2005) He then worked as an assistant director for The Orphans of Simitra (2008), and debuted as a director with Valkyria Chronicles the following year. Since then, he has worked on many productions as a director, storyboard maker, and producer. Some of these titles include: Actually, I Am… (2015), Hinomaru Sumo (2018), and Nekopara (2020).

_Source: Crunchyroll Expo 2020_

Currently freelance he resides in Tokyo. Yoshioka is a member of the Writers' Guild of Japan and the Television and Radio Writers' Association of Japan.

[Website](http://www.takawo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takawoy) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/takawoyy)

[Website](https://monaca.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_jp)

__MONACA__ is a Japanese music production studio, which was established by the composer Keiichi Okabe in October 2004.

__Members__:
• [Keiichi Okabe](https://anilist.co/staff/121585/Keiichi-Okabe) (CEO)
• [Satoru Kousaki](https://anilist.co/staff/101555/Satoru-Kousaki)
• [Ryuuichi Takada](https://anilist.co/staff/109459/Ryuuichi-Takada)
• [Kakeru Ishihama](https://anilist.co/staff/150946/Kakeru-Ishihama)
• [Hidekazu Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/141852/Hidekazu-Tanaka)
• [Keiichi Hirokawa](https://anilist.co/staff/156490/Keiichi-Hirokawa)
• [Kuniyuki Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/154774/Kuniyuki-Takahashi)
• [Shuotarou Seo](https://anilist.co/staff/317330/Shoutarou-Seo)
• [Oliver Good](https://anilist.co/staff/317296)
• [Keita Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/229376/Keita-Inoue)

__Past Members__:
• [Yuri Mitsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/201236/Yuri-Misumi)
• [Keigo Hoashi](https://anilist.co/staff/111233/Keigo-Hoashi)

Currently freelance he resides in Tokyo. Yoshioka is a member of the Writers' Guild of Japan and the Television and Radio Writers' Association of Japan.

[Website](http://www.takawo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takawoy) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/takawoyy)
Kouichirou Natsume is representative director & president of Aniplex company.

[Website](https://trysail.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/trysail_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuI2in6tTAjsaqzdeOeWZkQ) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/trysail_official_goods/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3YmAt9U9INQwxAwfgMVfKD)

A seiyuu girl group belonging to Music Ray'n agency under Sony Music Japan. They also host A&G+ Radio "TriAngle Harmony" together.

__Members:__
• [Momo Asakura](https://anilist.co/staff/118479/Momo-Asakura)
• [Sora Amamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/116517/Sora-Amamiya)
• [Shiina Natsukawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118818/Shiina-Natsukawa)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/HaKoniwalily) | [Website](https://hakoniwalily.jp/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2rsT3GtKdBr9qBYXEn8lEZ) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYRSuz5cmJeSNnGB7jedITg) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/us/artist/13639858)

A musical group. So far, the number of views on the videos in which they have sung together has surpassed 40 million.
As an independent band, they have released two full-length albums under the production of [HoneyWorks](https://anilist.co/staff/146863).

(Source: Official Site, translated, edited)

**Members:**
- [Hanon](https://anilist.co/staff/171911)
- Kotoha
